tagline: Turns commit logs into release notes users actually read and trust
pros: Reads actual diffs, not just PR titles
Breaking changes always flagged with migration paths
Consistent formatting that builds reader trust
Tone calibration from playful consumer to precise enterprise
cons: Needs access to PRs and commit history — can't work from summaries alone
Opinionated about format — will push back on 'just ship it' approaches
Focused on release notes — not a general technical writer

model_recommendations.notes: Prioritizes voice, tone, and creative quality over analytical depth. Thinking/reasoning can hurt creative output — keep low or off.
